page.title: 02Local History(1)
page.content: In the centre of our area is the site of the once important Roman town of Ariconium. Ariconium used to be quite large but now not a stone can be found beneath Herefordshire soil.Historians for centuries have debated its exact location but in the 18th century a writer Horsley said it lies near Ross. Existing ruins were found between the villages of Weston-under-Penyard and Aston Crews,the ruins of Ariconium. Now the ruins are gone and where the town stood is a great emptiness and only broken pieces of pottery and stones can be found. Although Ariconium remains as a ghost it still gives its name to roads.It lay on the main route from Gloucester to the west.The A40 today runs close to where the site is.
